Key Match Events: Travis Head (24) and David Warner (32) gave a good start before being dismissed by Adam Milne and Mitchell Santner
Skipper Mitchell Marsh (72*) built a small partnership with Glenn Maxwell (25) and Josh Inglis (20)
Tim David (31*) stood till the last with Marsh and led the Australian team to defeat New Zealand by 6 wickets
Australian skipper Mitchell Marsh was announced as the 'Player of the Match' for his 72 unbeaten runs and one wicket taken in the first innings
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's captain Mitchell Marsh and Tim David led their team beat New Zealand by 6 wickets at the Sky Stadium in Wellington
Chasing a target of 216 runs to win, Australian batters tried to play attacking shots and kept losing their wickets
Travis Head (24) and David Warner (32) did give a good start before being dismissed by Adam Milne and Mitchell Santner
Following this, skipper Mitchell Marsh (72*) remained on the crease and built small partnership with Glenn Maxwell (25) and Josh Inglis (20)
But Tim David (31*) stood till the last with him and led the Australian team to defeat New Zealand by 6 wickets
Australian skipper Mitchell Marsh was announced as the 'Player of the Match' for his 72 unbeaten runs and one wicket taken in the first innings
For the Kiwis, Mitchell Santner picked two wickets, while Lockie Ferguson and Adam Milne took one each
Batting first, Kiwis ended the first innings at Wellington on a total of 215/3, their second highest score at this venue
Devon Conway and Finn Allen provided a stellar start to the Kiwi until Allen was dismissed on a score of 36
Conway then stitched together an over 100 run partnership with Rachin Ravindra, placing the Kiwis over the 150 run mark
The final touch to the innings was put by Mark Chapman and Glenn Phillips who helped the Kiwis go past the 200 run mark
For Australia, Mitchell Marsh, Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins picked one wicket each
The two teams are set to play 3 T20 encounters, the last for both of them before the start of the T20 World Cup later this year
The Aussies are also in have been in red-hot form after defeating the West Indies 2-1 for the recently concluded T20 series and will be aiming to replicate this form against their neighbours
Moreover, this young Aussie side would be aiming to give David Warner a warm farewell on his last bilateral T20 series
New Zealand, on the other hand, won their last T20I series against Pakistan with a 4-1 margin and will be aiming to dominate their opponents in last T20 matches before the World Cup
The presence of these big names from both sides means that the first T20 between New Zealand and Australia is likely to be a high-scoring affair
The Sky Stadium pitch, while offering something for the bowlers, is likely to be more in favour of the batsmen, meaning a big score would be the likely outcome

New Zealand and Australia playing XI: Finn Allen, Devon Conway (wk), Rachin Ravindra, Glenn Phillips, Mark Chapman, Josh Clarkson, Mitch Santner (c), Adam Milne, Ish Sodhi, Tim Southee, Lockie Ferguson for New Zealand
Australia XI: Travis Head, David Warner, Mitchell Marsh (c), Glenn Maxwell, Josh Inglis (wk), Tim David, Matt Short, Pat Cummins, Mitch Starc, Adam Zampa, Josh Hazlewood
Post-Match Reflections: Australian skipper Mitchell Marsh was announced as the 'Player of the Match' for his 72 unbeaten runs and one wicket taken in the first innings
For the Kiwis, Mitchell Santner picked two wickets, while Lockie Ferguson and Adam Milne took one each
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mitchell Marsh, Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins picked one wicket each for Australia
Travis Head (24) and David Warner (32) provided a good start for Australia before being dismissed
Glenn Maxwell (25) and Josh Inglis (20) joined Marsh in the partnership
Tim David (31*) contributed significantly to Australia's victory
Mitchell Marsh was named the 'Player of the Match'
New Zealand's Mitchell Santner picked two wickets, while Lockie Ferguson and Adam Milne took one each
Batting first, New Zealand scored 215/3 in 20 overs
Australia chased 216 runs to win and won by 6 wickets
The match was part of a 3-match T20 series, with the next two matches to be played in Auckland
David Warner is playing his final bilateral T20 series for Australia
The teams are preparing for the T20 World Cup
The Sky Stadium pitch is expected to favor batsmen
